title: Assistive Technology
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a screen reader on a computer.]
narration: Welcome! Today we're going to explore the world of assistive technology.

title: What is Assistive Technology?
content:
Tools and devices that help people with disabilities
Improve their ability to perform tasks
Increase independence and participation
Can be used in various settings like home, school, and work
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A variety of assistive technology devices, such as a wheelchair, a screen reader, and a hearing aid.]
narration: Assistive technology, or AT for short, is all about helping people with disabilities overcome challenges and live more fulfilling lives. It's a broad category that includes a wide range of tools and devices designed to make tasks easier and more accessible.

title: Types of Assistive Technology
content:
Communication Devices
Mobility Aids
Sensory Aids
Cognitive Aids
Computer Access Aids
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A graphic showing icons representing different types of assistive technology.]
narration: Assistive technology can be categorized into different types, each addressing specific needs. We'll be looking at communication devices, mobility aids, sensory aids, cognitive aids, and computer access aids.

title: Communication Devices
content:
Augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) devices
Speech-generating devices
Communication boards
Sign language interpreters
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a speech-generating device to communicate.]
narration: Communication devices help individuals express themselves and interact with others. These can range from speech-generating devices that speak for the user to communication boards with pictures or symbols.

title: Mobility Aids
content:
Wheelchairs
Walkers
Canes
Orthotics and prosthetics
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a wheelchair to navigate a sidewalk.]
narration: Mobility aids help people with physical limitations move around more easily. This includes wheelchairs, walkers, canes, and even orthotics and prosthetics.

title: Sensory Aids
content:
Hearing aids
Cochlear implants
Braille readers
Magnifiers
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person wearing a hearing aid.]
narration: Sensory aids enhance or replace sensory functions. Examples include hearing aids, cochlear implants, Braille readers, and magnifiers for visual impairments.

title: Cognitive Aids
content:
Memory aids
Organizational tools
Time management apps
Cognitive training software
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a calendar app to manage their schedule.]
narration: Cognitive aids support individuals with cognitive challenges such as memory issues or attention deficits. This includes memory aids, organizational tools, and even cognitive training software.

title: Computer Access Aids
content:
Screen readers
Speech recognition software
Alternative keyboards
Mouse replacements
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a screen reader to navigate a computer.]
narration: Computer access aids make technology more accessible for people with disabilities. Screen readers read aloud text on the screen, speech recognition software allows users to control the computer with their voice, and alternative keyboards and mouse replacements offer different ways to interact with the computer.

title: Benefits of Assistive Technology
content:
Increased independence
Improved quality of life
Enhanced participation in society
Greater access to education and employment
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A group of people with disabilities participating in a variety of activities, such as working, learning, and socializing.]
narration: Assistive technology brings numerous benefits. It empowers individuals with disabilities to live more independently, improve their quality of life, and participate fully in society. It opens doors to education, employment, and social connections.

title: Conclusion
image_desc: [Image Description in English only: A person using a wheelchair to access a ramp, symbolizing accessibility and inclusion.]
narration: Assistive technology is a powerful tool that can make a real difference in the lives of people with disabilities. By understanding its various types and benefits, we can work towards creating a more inclusive and accessible world for everyone.
